member.name: M:ScreenGrab6.Vector.JSON.JsonDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value
member.returns: An ArrayList, a Hashtable, a double, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:ScreenGrab6.Vector.JSON.JsonDecode(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value; and fills 'success' with the successfullness of the parse.
member.returns: An ArrayList, a Hashtable, a double, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:ScreenGrab6.Vector.JSON.JsonEncode(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a Hashtable / ArrayList object into a JSON string
member.returns: A JSON encoded string, or null if object 'json' is not serializable

member.name: M:ScreenGrab6.Vector.JSON.IsNumeric(System.Object)
member.summary:
Determines if a given object is numeric in any way (can be integer, double, null, etc).
Thanks to mtighe for pointing out Double.TryParse to me.

member.name: T:ScreenGrab6.Vector.JSON
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes ArrayList and Hashtable. All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: M:ScreenGrab6.Vector.Helper.GetFontFilespec(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the physical location of a font family from the registry
